column4: is there  a prob with the 10.10 network - tried kubuntu and ubuntu  and a distro based on it and can't connect eth0 or wlan0
sounds like it's not recognizing your devices for whatever reason...
it does an i can contact AP (router) just not outside it -- all other computers work
then my first thought would be something inside the router that is not allowing it out...
no every other computer can use it
now thats for your ethernet.... your wireless could be a whole other issue.
so?
then it's not th router
i'm amazed you needed to come here, you have all the answers(for what its worth,d ealt w/ this yesterday, and it WAS the router)
all the older versions work as do all other distroes -- just not anything with network-manager --- ass i never got help yesterday -- everytime i come here there is a prick like you
well, sorry you think i'm a prick, yous houldn't feel obligated to reply further...
great then shut up
i didn't say you got help yesterday, i said i dealt w th the same problem, and resolved it by fixing the router.. go ahead though, trudge on
it's not the router ever other distro i install works
ok.. you seem to feel intent on convincing me of this.. i could care less, my internet works just fine.
mine as well - just not with 10.10
well, then i guess you have issues.
yes you are one of them
then why are you inclined to talk to me?.. there's 1300 people here, find someone else to whine to.
please be quiet
all youhave to do is stop talking to me.. i offered to end this long ago.
